noun.description: The provision of fresh air to a room, building, etc.
examples: ventilation of the mines had long been mechanized

noun.description: Public discussion or examination of an opinion, issue, or complaint.

origin: Late Middle English (in the sense current of air): from Old French, or from Latin ventilatio(n-), from the verb ventilare (see ventilate). ventilation (sense 1) dates from the mid 17th century.
